intro: Psychotria officinalis, commonly known as the "Amazonian nightshade," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including psychotrine and harmine, which have been studied for their psychoactive properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its chemical composition, it has been used traditionally in some indigenous cultures for ritual and medicinal purposes.
